title: President instructs to fulfil nurses’ demands
content:
President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has instructed that the demands made by the Nurses’ Trade Union be met, taking into consideration the financial situation of the country and without affecting the public service.
“Health services, including medical and the nursing staff are highly valued.” 
“Take steps to provide the approved nurses’ demands while understanding the financial situation in the country and without affecting the public service,” the President has said.
President Rajapaksa had stated this during the discussion held at the Presidential Secretariat yesterday morning (17) as per the request of the Public Services United Nurses’ Union (PSUNU), the President’s Media Division said. 
The demands taken up for discussion included setting up of a University for Nurses, the existing 36 hours of working hours as five working days a week as 30 hours of duty, that the proposed Rs 10,000 allowance be  proportional to the Rs 35,000 DAT allowance paid to medical professionals, issuing of the uniform allowance circular and extra service allowance at the rate of 1/100 of the basic salary.
